name: slamseq-rna-stability
title: RNA Stability & Kinetics (SLAM-seq)
description: Measure RNA synthesis, degradation, and half-lives using metabolic labeling (SLAM-seq). Distinguishes newly synthesized RNA from pre-existing RNA for transcriptome-wide kinetic analysis. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,replicate`
content:
RNA Stability & Kinetics Analysis

SLAM-seq (SLAMborant Labeling And Mutational sequencing) uses metabolic labeling with 4-thiouridine (s4U) to distinguish new RNA from old RNA, enabling measurement of RNA synthesis rates, degradation rates, and half-lives.

How SLAM-seq Works

  1. Metabolic Labeling: Add s4U to cells (pulse labeling)
  2. RNA Extraction: Harvest total RNA
  3. Chemical Conversion: s4U → T-to-C mutations during RT-PCR
  4. Sequencing: Detect T-to-C conversions
  5. Analysis: Separate new RNA (labeled) from old RNA (unlabeled)

What You Can Measure

  • RNA Synthesis Rate: How fast RNA is made
  • RNA Degradation Rate: How fast RNA is degraded
  • RNA Half-Life: Stability of each transcript
  • New vs Old RNA: Fraction of newly synthesized RNA
  • Transcriptional Response: Immediate vs delayed changes

Scientific Applications

  • RNA Stability Regulation: microRNA effects, RNA-binding proteins
  • Drug MOA: Does drug affect transcription or degradation?
  • Viral Infection: Host shutoff, viral RNA kinetics
  • Stress Response: Rapid vs sustained responses
  • Circadian Rhythms: Time-dependent RNA turnover
  • Developmental Timing: Maternal RNA clearance, zygotic activation

Advantages Over Standard RNA-seq

RNA-seq: Steady-state RNA (synthesis + degradation)

SLAM-seq: Separate synthesis from degradation

  • No transcription inhibitors needed (actinomycin D, etc.)
  • Single time point analysis possible
  • Transcriptome-wide measurement
  • Works in vivo and in vitro

Pipeline Features

  • T-to-C Detection: Identify s4U-labeled reads (Slamdunk)
  • New vs Old Separation: Classify reads as labeled or unlabeled
  • Kinetic Modeling: Calculate synthesis/degradation rates
  • Half-Life Estimation: RNA stability per gene
  • Differential Kinetics: Compare conditions (DESeq2)
  • Quality Control: Label incorporation, conversion rates

Input Requirements

Design TSV file with samples and conditions. Include time points for kinetic modeling.

Key Outputs

  • New RNA Counts: Newly synthesized transcripts
  • Old RNA Counts: Pre-existing transcripts
  • Synthesis Rates: Per-gene transcription rates
  • Degradation Rates: Per-gene decay rates
  • Half-Lives: RNA stability measurements
  • Differential Kinetics: Changed synthesis/degradation

Perfect for: RNA stability • Transcription kinetics • Drug MOA • Viral infection • Circadian biology • Development
